Name: Fields of Honor: World War II
Description:
From the publisher:
Fields of Honor:World War II is a fast-paced wargame from Pinnacle. This new edition brings the battlefields of Europe to your tabletop and puts you in command of a company or more of US or German troops. The rules are easy to learn and quick to play, and provide a wealth of tactical options.

Included in this book are basic and advanced rules, the tokens and counters needed to play, Battle and Command Cards that introduce the uncertainty and surprises of the battlefield, and army lists for US and German forces of World War II, covering all major troop types and weaponry.

The Fields of Honor includes the rules, War in the West campaign, Terrain Pack 1, containing the scenery needed to fight your tabletop battles, and Battleset 1, which features every major troop type and support asset for the US and German forces on the Western Front.

With this, the ultimate Fields of Honor bundle, you can fight for control of Europe, from the bloody beaches of Omaha on D-Day, to the last throw of dice in the Bulge, and on to Remagen, with countless stops along the way.

Name: Zizanie beach
Description:
This game comes with Jeux & Stratégie magazine n.17 (January/February 2006)

In what is ultimately an abstract game, two players, each representing a male, compete on an evolving archipelago (which they build in the beginning of the game) and aim to end up isolated with the only girl on the set of islands.

On his turn, the player must first move his own pawn or move the girlfriend, and then move an island to another place in the archipelago.

Name: Die Koala Brüder: Auf Geht's Nach Haus!
Description:
KOALA BROTHERS - LET'S GO HOME is a childrens memory  game based on the animated children's television series.

What a mess!  The vehicles belonging to the Koala Brothers and their friends are completely mixed up and little by little, as night falls, the way home is hard to find.  Where is the scooter? Who knows where Frank and Buster’s house is?  Your mission is to help the friends to get themselves and their vehicles back to the right house.

The game is comprised of five small boards representing the homes of the Koala Brothers and their friends. Each house has three spaces on it.  The (two) Koala brothers and four of their friends appear on six red counters and their preferred means of transport are represented on five blue counters (the koala brothers fly a twin seater plane).

At the start of the game the counters are mixed up, one of the red ones removed, and the remaining ten distributed at random between the houses.

Players take it in turns to roll a special die and take actions accordingly:

•    If it shows a number then the player moves a piece of his choice the number of free spaces indicated on the die.  Movement can be in either a clockwise or anticlockwise direction.
•    If it shows an eye the player can secretly look at a counter of his/her choice.
•    If it shows an arrow the player selects a playing piece of his/her choice and turns it up so that everyone can see.

Players may also gamble tokens by secretly peeking at counters.  If the counter is at the right house then it wins tokens, if not it loses tokens.

Play proceeds until all the friends and their vehicles are face up in the right location.  The player with the greatest number of tokens is the winner.

Name: Walk the Plank
Description:
The object of the game is to collect 4 pieces of treasure from the Treasure Chest.

To this end, players have to move their ship from a dockside towards the island where the treasure is. They do this by rolling up to 4 colored dice. Each player rolls as many dice as there are players each time it's his/her go. Each player moves their ship according to the number on the die corresponding to their ship. If a player lands on a place next to a plank, the other players must shout out "Walk the Plank" before the dice are thrown again. If they succeed in this, the player concerned must go back to the start.

Name: Scrambled Heads!
Description:
SCRAMBLED HEADS! - The Crazy Clues Game! is a similar game to HEADBANZ and others of that ilk.

Players take it in turns to be the 'Head Case' by placing a headpiece on their head. A card is placed in the headpiece by another player such that it can be seen by all the players except the one actually wearing the headpiece.

The game card shows three subjects in three different categories - Food and Drink, Entertainment and Miscellaneous.  The subject is something that should be familiar to all the players and could be anything from a famous film star to a wild animal.

The 'Head Case' selects whether he wishes clues on the category on the top, middle or bottom row of his card, and is then informed of which particular category the subject belongs to.

The other players then take it in turns to offer clues as to what the subject is.  Clues should be relevant to the subject but somewhat distant and slightly cryptic.  Clues should not be derived from part of the subject title.  The 'Head Case' has 10 seconds to try and guess the text on the card at which point the next player gives another clue.

Tokens are added into a central pile to indicate how many clues have been given - these tokens having been evenly distributed amongst the players at the start of the game. If the 'Head Case' guesses the subject then the player that gave the last clue must collect all the tokens.  A player also gains them if he is unable to provide a suitable clue.  In the event of the 'Head Case' not guessing the answer within 12 clues he fails and collects all the tokens from the pile,

Another player is then selected as the 'Head Case' and the while process is repeated.  Play continues until one of the players runs out of tokens or when all players agree to stop.

Name: Word Master
Description:
Word Master is the perfect crossword-style game for having fun with words. It can be played anywhere, and with any number of people. The box includes all game components, plus a book with easy-to-follow rules and quick-reference anagram lists. Includes: 5 lettered dice, 200 magnetic letter tiles, game board and book of rules.

The game is won by having the highest score.  Each word scores 1 point + 1 point per letter + any bonuses.

Name: Tug Boat
Description:
Move your barge around the board from port to port by pushing it with the Tug, but make sure not to hit any buoys and sound the alarms. 
Play passes from one player to another whenever a buoy is hit and the alarm sounds, or when the marble reaches the end of the ramp. The first player to get all four of their loads to their final ports wins.

Name: Cirkle 2
Description:
The game contains an 8×11 board and two armies (Yellow & Blue). Each army consists of 16 pieces (4 of each kind) with different abilities for each group.

The players deploy their armies (chess like) and try to capture 2 objective points on the enemy side.

There is a 4-player version of the game called: Cirkle 4

Name: Cranium: Hullabaloo DVD Game
Description:
From the publisher:
Just pop in the DVD, and the Hullabaloo host will guide you through your adventure, from setting up the 16 animal play pads to standing on a purple Cranium pad to start. You'll fly like an eagle to a triangle, stomp like a gorilla to a red pad, and swim to an animal that lives in the ocean!

Play along with the Hullabaloo Kids on-screen as you follow the host's instructions. When you hear, "Freeze!" everyone stays still and waits for the lucky pad to be announced. Everyone touching the lucky pad is a winner, and every game ends with a different celebration -- winners might take a bow, dance, do a victory jump, or … who knows? Part of the fun is finding out!

Name: Peak Experience: The Climbing Game
Description:
A multiple choice trivia game based on the broad range of challenges and experiences faced by real climbers - from airport bureaucracy to the final descent.

Anyone can play Peak Experience - you don't have to be an expert climber.  If you enjoy adventure and the outdoors you'll love Peak Experience.  Come climbing on awesome K2.  Travel through exotic Pakistan on the trek towards base camp.  Use your knowledge, common sense and judgment to make it to the summit and back to base camp.  As in real climbing, success takes both skill and luck.  So whether you are a veteran climber or an armchair adventurer, reach for the peak!

Name: Mentalogy
Description:
Mentalogy is a game which requires the player to remember and then recall a series of different words, numbers and pictures.

The winner is the first player to reach the finish point by remembering all the cards on the green, yellow, red and blue triangles in any order!

Name: Suffolk Downs
Description: A horse racing game from The Corey Game Company about Boston's own race track,  Suffolk Downs.

Name: Get Up and Go
Description:
From back of box:

Don't just sit there...Play!!

Draw a card.  Did you get an Astronaut?  A Ballerina?  WOW! An ALLIGATOR!
GET UP & GO!  Be an over-active alligator for 20 seconds!  Put up your arms to make pretend alligator jaws.  Open up wide and jump in the swamp for a quick swim.  Wiggle and Wag!  Stomp and Chomp!  You were a great alligator!  Other players will award you points for your perfect performance!

Contents:
55 Game Cards
24 Scoring Tiles
Sand Timer
Game Rules

Name: Crossings
Description:
Crossings is an abstract strategy game for two players published in Sid Sackson's A Gamut of Games and Stephen Addison's 100 Other Games to Play on a Chessboard

It can be played with a standard set of Checkers.

The object of the game is to reach the opposite side of the board, while preventing the opponent from doing the same, by
moving checkers in "phalanx" style.  Crossings is effectively an ancestor of Epaminondas, but with two 
crucial differences.  
 1) When phalanxes collide, only the front piece is captured.
 2) Successfully "crossed" pieces are immobile and can't be captured.

Reimplemented-by:
Epaminondas on a 14x12 board

Name: Gridrunner
Description: (from the manual) Gridrunner is a strategy game from two to four players.  The object of the game is to move your pieces over the board and capture the pieces of the other players.  The player with the most pieces at the end of the game wins.  Playing time is two to three hours.

Name: Monopoly: Maailman Ihmeet
Description: In this version of Monopoly players are travelling around the world and there are different wonders of the world instead of properties.

Name: Axis & Allies:  A & A Accessories
Description:
This accessories kit is to be used with the Milton Bradley Axis & Allies game.  The accessories consist of operating rules for the new pieces only (included).  275 color coordinated plastic pieces, scaled to size, consisting of, heavy fighters, jeeps, jet fighters, land mines, landing craft, super bombers, and V2 rockets.

Expands:

    Axis & Allies

Name: Air-Attack
Description: This game is about plane to plane combat. The Corey Game Company produced a number of early games that were unique in that they were far more elaborate than other games from the same era.

Name: Charmed: The Source
Description:
Alternate name: Charmed La Source

The Source is the dominant Power of Evil. It strives to install its Reign of Terror over the World. It leads its hoards of demons in its attempt to enslave humanity. Only one obstacle blocks its path. It must eliminate the Halliwell sisters and take hold of their powers. When Prue died, the Source was certain it had overcome the Power of the 3; but now the sisters are three again and their powers are strengthened. The source can no longer send lesser demons against them: it must personally intervene to put an end to the Halliwell Sisters. Phoebe, Piper and Paige must once again out wit the Forces of Evil itself.

The Source is a games based on characters and themes from the latest seasons of the television series "Charmed". You play the main characters Piper, Phoebe, Paige and Cole in their battle against the Source. You must unmask the Source's lieutenants and eliminate them before you can face the Lord of Evil. Beware! You must work fast lest the source finds a way to overcome the Power of the 3 and win the Game!

Name: The Abounding River
Description:
The ABOUNDING RIVER GAME is an exploration board game that introduces people to an unfamiliar view of BEING ABUNDANCE. It encompasses both training people in a day to day practice as well as discovering a Spiritual foundation that opens up to a whole new way of looking at money and resources.

People experience themselves being at the source of unlimited supply.

Name: Niagara: The Spirits of Niagara
Description:
Expansion for Niagara. From the publisher:

The search for jewels across the raging torrent of Niagara continues - and now, river ghosts come into the game. With larger canoes (which can hold more gems), extra paddle cards and river ghosts who can help during moments of extreme danger, the award-winning game becomes even more exciting.

Name: Bärenbande
Description:
From Adam Spielt:

A fun dice- and hiding-game using a color die. Bärenbande is a simple color die game that is fun for even the smallest players. If the bear symbol is rolled, the children get to rearrange the game board. That causes hiding places to be revealed and laughter echoes through the woods. And with a little luck, the bear slips away to his hiding spot again.

Contents: 12 bears in 4 colors, 1 game board, 1 board overlay, 1 color die, 1 sound module.

Name: Battle for Stalingrad Micro Game
Description:
The Battle for Stalingrad WWII Micro Strategy Board Game is a fast paced mini game for two players. It covers Stalingrad and the surrounding area, and begins with the German 1942 offensive on the Russian Front.

It was published in Empires of History Magazine issue #1, and includes:
-11" x 14.75" full color game board
-2 zone maps for Upper and Lower Stalingrad
-108 plastic playing tokens

Name: Bedlam
Description:
Contents:

One spinner, one queen sized sheet.

From the back of the box:

"For best results more than one player is needed.

The object of Bedlam is to maneuver you and your partner into the most compromising positions possible.

To start, each player sits on the Bedlam sheet. Sensuous bedroom attire and a bottle of wine can add pleasure to the game.

Each player takes turns spinning the Bedlam spinner. When the spinner points to one of the four colors the player who spun may move a hand or foot to that color. Knees and elbows may touch the sheet.

If the spinner points to Anything Goes, that player is given complete freedom of movement over the entire Bedlam sheet. This player may position their body any place on the game sheet as long as the other player(s) do not move from their positions. When the player is satisfied with their position, play resumes.

If a player spins Your Request, the player who spun may position the other players on the Bedlam sheet in any position desired as long as they do not move from their position.

When the players have reached compromising positions, Bedlam is declared and you take it from there. Have fun and remember, 'It's not whether you win or lose but Where you play the game'."

Re-implements:

    Twister

Name: Pingu på skattjakt
Description: Easy bluffing game for children. You choose small ice blocks and then one opponent tries to deceive you whether there is gold underneath the block or not. The first player to collect five gold is the winner.

Name: Bible Categories
Description:
Quick! How fast can you name from the Bible . . .

. . . a river
. . . a plague
. . . a place where Paul preached
. . . a miracle involving food
. . . a descendant of Adam
. . . a story involving fish

. . . all using the letter "T" in your answer? And for extra points, can you name where your answer is recorded in the Bible? But, remember to be original! If your response is the same as an opponent's, you score nothing!

Whether you're a beginning Bible reader or an advanced Scripture scholar, you'll love playing Bible Categories! It's a fun and exciting way for family, friends, youth groups, or Sunday school classes to sharpen their Bible knowledge. And with 300 different categories, you'll never play the same game twice!

Curious as to which answer will win the game? Grab a group and play Bible Categories to find out! It's the fast-thinking Bible game that will leave you amazed at how much you already know and how much you can learn!

Includes: 25 Category Cards, 23 Letter Cards, 4 sets of Bible Categories scoring pads, 4 pencils, timer, and instruction sheet (including optional play suggestions for less challenging play, more challenging play, and play with people of varying degrees of Bible knowledge).

Name: Bible Charades
Description:
The historical game of hysterical fun!

You've played charades before, but never like this! A new twist on Bible knowledge games that is guaranteed to animate every party, youth group, classroom, or family gathering. Teams of players race around the game board by correctly guessing charades of clues in one of six categories.

Bible Charades provides an excellent way for families and friends to strengthen their knowledge of God's Word.

Simple versatile rules allow for limitless variations

1,200 charade titles in 6 categories

Color coded categories with convenient on the board reference

Optional timer - select your own pace

2-4 teams, Ages 10 and up

Games includes: 200 boxed topic cards, game board, four playing pieces, die, 30 plastic chips and instruction sheet.

Name: Bible Land Adventure Game
Description:
BibleLand is a fun and exciting game that takes youngsters on a journey through the Bible, from Creation to Heaven. With different play options for different ages, BibleLand is fun for all and a great tool to use for introducing your children to the Bible.

Recommended for Ages 3 - 6.

Name: Monkey, Ninja, Pirate, Robot Deluxe
Description:
A venerable cabal bent on world-domination has sent one of their greatest champions to steal the reactor core... but so have their enemies. Bathed in atomic radiation, these champions fight to the death, in order to claim the sweet, sweet uranium for their people... and victory!

This is a game of marker-management where each combatant can manipulate their various character ratings (Attack, Defense, Mojo, etc.) each turn while trying to eliminate their opponent's tokens. Tokens can be replenished or stolen from the central pot. The player to eliminate all of his enemies first wins but variable character special abilities, usable on their turns, as well as random mutations can complicate the effort.

Re-implements:

    Monkey, Ninja, Pirate, Robot

Name: ZIN
Description:
This game is played on a 7x7 square board.The board shows several "win-fields", each depicting two symbols (male and female).

The players take turns drawing a tile from his own stack of tiles. They then place the tile on the board. The tile shows one of three symbols: male, female and mountain. The tile must be played next to a win-field, in such a way that the symbols match (a mountain can be played next to a side that shows both male and female, or neither).

When a win-field is completely surrounded, it is scored. Both players count the tiles they have next to the win-field (tiles are worth one or two points). The player who has the most points scores as many points as his opponents has present.

The game ends when all tiles have been played. At that point, some extra points are distributed and the total score is determined. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Bible Characters
Description:
From the Publisher: "A popular form of Bible Study for the home, and profitable entertainment for social gatherings for young and old."

Consists of 33 cards, each featuring a character from the Bible.  4 clues on each card lead players to the correct character.  The instructions include 9 play variants, including a version of charades.

Name: Up The ...... Corporation
Description:
Up The......Corporation was designed to take an irreverent look at the corporate office environment.  Everyone who has ever worked in an office will recognize the “employees” in this game, as they will have met their counterparts.

The situations presented are actual experiences with incompetent management, office politics, corporate rules, unending meetings, nepotism, discrimination and dysfunctional office workers.

However, don’t get the wrong idea, this game isn’t work!  IT’S FUN!!!  You can vent all of your frustrations and laugh at just how ridiculous the corporate environment has become.

Features: 
1 Game Platform with Corporate Ladder
8 Character Playing Pieces
8 Character Profile Cards, 8 Rewards Cards
54 Salary Cards, 76 Education Cards, 72 Politics Cards
88 Hardwork Cards, 92 Ethics Cards, 100 Strategy Cards

Name: Riistavisa
Description: A Finnish trivia game about hunting, from hunters for hunters.

Name: Le Secret de Grimbergen
Description:
Le Secret de Grimbergen (The Secret of Grimbergen) is a deduction game produced for the Grimbergen Abbey Brewery in Belgium.  The game is described as being a "Medieval Adventure" and is published in French and Dutch.

From the box:

Walk through the corridors and rooms of Grimbergen Abbey to find the monks that will permit you to discover the secret of the beer that you wish to make.  You will need to unite the three monks that each know a part of the secret, in one of the rooms in the Abbey.  In order to do this you will need to enter the secret maze, pass through obscure tunnels and battle with your adversaries.  Who will be the first to discover the Secret of Grimbergen?

Components:

1 board
2 d6
5 playing pieces
1 pad of sheets showing plans of the Abbey
12 monk markers
12 'secret' cards (showing which three monks you need to find) 
44 Abbey cards
5 pencils
1 set of rules

Name: The Black Heritage Trivia Game
Description: The Black Heritage Trivia Game is a fun and challenging way to show what you know about black history and culture.  The game contains over 1200 questions and answers.  Get the answers right and make your way to the inner circle.  But be careful, your opponent is trying to send you back to the start!  Be ready for hours of enlightening entertainment.

Name: Friendzee: Close Connections Edition
Description:
Players move game pieces around the Friendzee game board by rolling cubes that direct them to draw from three sets of cards:
1) LIVE OUT LOUD--surprising and meaningful experiences challenge participants to tell stories, sculpt clay, write, sketch, perform charades...and more.
2) DIVE IN DEEP--gets them digging into Bible passages and studying God's Word together on a more personal level.
3) RISKZEE--a roll of the dice directs players to do both wacky and Bible-themed activities as they explore Scripture.
All three cards guide teens around the game board and to the ENDZEE. There are no winners and no losers--the game ends when everyone reaches the ENDZEE and commits to a challenge for the week.

The Close Connections Edition helps teens build close friendships by having them discuss Acceptance, Forgiveness, Trust, Accountability, Transparency, and Genuine Love.

Name: XIG 4E: Fire Pathway
Description:
XIG is a tile-laying game where players try to be the first to complete their own pathway - based on one of four elements: Earth, Water, Fire, and Air - as quickly as possible by laying down puzzle-piece style tiles. There are also cards that can help you advance or hinder your opponent. The pathways are sold in complete sets, and booster packs of cards are currently planned.

The base game includes the Water and Earth pathways.  This is one of the first two expansions for the game (the other being the Air pathway).  It includes the entire Fire pathway, a set of XAG cards, a small "collector's" box, and 2 special bonus "new edition" XAG cards plus 1 special "limited edition" foil puzzle piece.  Other future expansions are hinted at in the rules.

Expands:

    XIG: The Four Elements

Name: Yak
Description:
From the rule sheet:
Yak is a board game for 2 players, which involves a combination of luck and skill.  Typical duration of the game is about 15 minutes.

Objectives:
The object of the game is to move your counters across the board whilst your opponent moves their counters across the board in the opposite direction.  The winner is the first player to remove off all of their counters.

Equipment:
A long narrow board marked with 16 squares in a single line.  There are 16 counters and 4 dice, 8 white counters plus 2 white dice and 8 black counters plus 2 black dice.

Name: The Battle of the Bulge: Panzers in the Snow
Description:
This is a Japanese wargame about the Battle of the Bulge 1944.
It was mostly called "SS Bulge" because there are many games of the same name.

This game was firstly published as one of the Series: SS (Sho-Kikaku) in 1990.
Republished in Command Magazine Japan #46 in 2002, along with D-Day.

Designed by Yasushi Nakaguro.
Families: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

Name: Dicecar
Description:
From the publisher's web site:

This is Dicecar's Tri-Oval Speedway. Now available with either Dicecar Jr. rules and Extreme Dicecar rules packages.
Here’s the skinny of what Dicecar is. Dicecar is a Table Top Racing game that is played using dice and cards. The drivers must have their own 1/64th scale race cars. These are available at most department stores in the toy section or at your local racing collectible stores. Some spaces on the race track allow you lane changes or prompt you to draw cards which could be good or bad. Pit road is outlined in yellow, so you know where the speed limit begins. Strategies include pit stops in which you choose gas only, one side or both sides tire changes. Avoiding trouble and making moves which can put you in front of the competition are important strategies as well. To win you must be the first driver to cross the start/finish line after completing all of the laps and pit stops. Table Top Racing is no fantasy as you race face to face with your family and friends. Everyone can race at Dicecar. You don’t need to be a race fan to enjoy the game. Racing knowledge can help but it is not necessary. Experience counts, so race a few times as you develop your strategy. Dicecar includes qualifying, drafting, unscheduled pit stops for tire or engine trouble. Crashes can happen and the yellow flag will bring out the pace car for a caution. Have fun racing and building your 1/64th scale racing world. Different tracks are available as well as accessories like the high banks and soft walls. Other items such as the pace car, jet dryer trucks, tow trucks and ambulances are also available and make your world of Dicecar a lot of fun.

Name: Don't Touch That Dial
Description: Return with us now to those thrilling days of yesteryear, as players compete from coast-to-coast to build the most successful radio network. Players control NBC-Red, NBC-Blue, CBS or Mutual. They bid to purchase popular programs and hire stars to host them. They sell the shows to sponsors who will pay well to brand their products with the right show. They advertise in local markets to add listeners and increase ratings. The player with the most popular network at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: ConverStation
Description:
This game was created by a speech pathologist to ensure that conversation doesn't become a lost art.  The designer found that children that are not used to adult conversation will often reply to questions with one-word answers or an answer not related to what the question that they were asked.  The game is also helpful for adults that have had strokes, brain injuries, or are attempting to relearn or expand their language skills.

As a player lands on certain colored game board squares in a train track format, a player chooses one of 240 question cards, divided into the four corresponding color categories of "Wh- Questions, "If I...", "Tell about...", and "How do you...".  The game cards have three levels: kids, adults, and both.

The companion workbook called ConverStation Graphic Expression teaches people when to express themselves in writing versus conversation.

The board game hit the market in June 2005, winning the 2005 Preferred Choice Award from Creative Child magazine as a Toy of the Year Finalist.

The game is published by Say It Right, a small press educational publisher based in Tybee Island, Georgia.  Their website is www.sayitright.org.

Name: Who Do You See?
Description:
The Hidden Picture Game That Teaches Biblical Principles!

Another "No Reading Required" game in the "My First Game" series. It plays like "Where's Waldo?" or the "I Spy" games. Find the pictures on your token cards on the action panels.

6 hidden picture cards and 200 hidden picture squares.

Suitable for Ages 4 and up.

Name: Beginning Math Roll & Learn Pocket Cubes
Description:
Here's an innovative new way to learn Beginning Math skills, plus, as an added bonus, your students will have so much fun they won't realize how much they're learning!

Rather than the same old boring drills, numerous worksheets, or endless practice exercises, introduce your students to an exciting new way of learning with the Roll & Learn Pocket Cubes. The set includes: two pocket cubes made of the same durable material as our pocket charts, 24 learning cards, and a resource guide. The learning cards are designed to slide easily into plastic sleeves that are located on each side of the cube. Each card has either a photograph or colorful text printed on it.

The game instructions vary depending on the skill being taught that day. Some games require both cubes being tossed, while others have students toss one cube and find the correct answer on the remaining cube. The games include: numerals and number sets, shapes, numbers comparisons, as well as simple addition. These games can be played with either the whole class or placed in a learning center for small group or individual play.

This set is a terrific tool for teaching with a kinesthetic approach.

Name: Full Armor of God
Description:
This "peel `n' play" game comes with silver vinyl armor for each board. Play the game in the car or at home to take advantage of the opportunities to teach your child about the Full Armor of God. Just spin the dial and see who can be the first to get a full suit of armor.

• Helps children grasp the concept of putting on the Full Armor of God.

• Includes a Faith Parenting Guide® that provides ideas to reinforce the values of the product into the life of the child.

Name: Kid's Bible Challenge
Description:
OBJECT: To be the first Player or team to move from Genesis (start) to Revelation (finish),

CONTENTS: 100 trivia cards that are divided into 6 categories.

Each Category is represented by a color/symbol:

Orange / Tablets = 0ld Testament

Green / Cross = New Testament

Red / City = Places

Yellow / Rainbow = Objects and Events

Brown / 123 = Numbers

Blue / ? = General

- 4 colored player markers, a 6-sided die, playing board and travel box,

Name: Beginning Language Roll & Learn Pocket Cubes
Description:
Here's an innovative new way to learn Beginning Language skills, plus, as an added bonus, your students will have so much fun they won't realize how much they're learning! Rather than the same old boring drills, numerous worksheets, or endless practice exercises, introduce your students to an exciting new way of learning with the Roll & Learn Pocket Cubes.

The set includes: two pocket cubes made of the same durable material as our pocket charts, 24 learning cards, and a resource guide. The learning cards are designed to slide easily into plastic sleeves that are located on each side of the cube. Each card has either a photograph or colorful text printed on it.

The game instructions vary depending on the skill being taught that day. Some games require both cubes being tossed, while others have students toss one cube and find the correct answer on the remaining cube. The games include: picture and word matching, alphabetical order, initial sounds, compound words, and long and short vowels. These games can be played with either the whole class or placed in a learning center for small group or individual play.

This set is a terrific tool for teaching with a kinesthetic approach.

Name: Deep Space Division Fission
Description: Put a mathematical twist on the classic card game "War!" In place of ordinary flashcard drills, players solve basic addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division facts as they try to win all the cards in the deck. (108) 3 inch x 4-1/2 inch cards. 2 or more players.

Name: Extreme Action Subtraction
Description: Put a mathematical twist on the classic card game "War!" In place of ordinary flashcard drills, players solve basic addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division facts as they try to win all the cards in the deck. (108) 3 inch x 4-1/2 inch cards. 2 or more players.

Name: Underwater Addition Mission
Description: Put a mathematical twist on the classic card game "War!" In place of ordinary flashcard drills, players solve basic addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division facts as they try to win all the cards in the deck. (108) 3 inch x 4-1/2 inch cards. 2 or more players.

Name: World Vacation Multiplication
Description: Put a mathematical twist on the classic card game "War!" In place of ordinary flashcard drills, players solve basic addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division facts as they try to win all the cards in the deck. (108) 3 inch x 4-1/2 inch cards. 2 or more players.

Name: Vanished Planet: Racial Advantage Expansion
Description:
Free to print & play (see link in Weblinks section below).

From the publisher's website (vanishedplanet.com):

The official Vanished Planet expansion is here! The expansion adds a new race, new racial powers for all races, new movement rules, and a twist to the Creature. Vanished Planet is more fun than ever!

Expands:

    Vanished Planet

Name: Family Derby
Description: Family Derby is a horse racing simulation game. Players bet on horses each race to Win Place and/or Show. The game ends after a series of races with the winner determined by which player has totaled the most winnings.

Name: Trackin' Animals: Mammals in the African Savanna, Pine Forest, and Ocean
Description: Grab your binoculars and join the Wild Goose team on a Trackin’ Animals photo safari! Three different games in each box have players chasing animals across the continents, through the oceans, and even back in time. Collect and assemble animal photos, draw and trade cards to make matching pairs, and correctly answer trivia questions to win these games, but watch out for all kinds of crazy twists when special Wild Cards appear! Each set contains 56 cards and directions for three different games to play. Ages 5 and up.

Name: Trackin' Animals: Dinosaurs
Description: Grab your binoculars and join the Wild Goose team on a Trackin’ Animals - Dinosaurs photo safari! Three different games in each box have players chasing animals across the continents, through the oceans, and even back in time. Collect and assemble animal photos, draw and trade cards to make matching pairs, and correctly answer trivia questions to win these games, but watch out for all kinds of crazy twists when special Wild Cards appear! Each set contains 56 cards and directions for three different games to play. Ages 5 and up.

Name: Masterquiz
Description:
MASTERQUIZ comes with 600 question cards each of which has 9 questions on the following subjects - Geography, Natural History, Oddball, Arts, Life, Science, Entertainment, Sport, History - the answers are printed on the reverse of the question card.  Also included are a gameboard, pack of 55 subject category cards, playing chips, score pad and rules book.

The questions and various combinations of the other components are used to make 4 different quiz games described on the box as follows:

Game 1
Choose your specialist subject.  Answer the crucial questions.  Move on to the inner General Knowledge track.  Use guile and genius, leapfrog past opponents to win at the center.

Game 2
Here's a game for the family, a party or your club's quiz night.  It's easy to play - decide the subject rounds.  There's a simple, effective, scoring system with a score pad to keep the tally.

Game 3
It's not only your knowledge but your card playing skills combined with a slice of luck that makes a winner in this engrossing game.  Each card dealt entitles you to answer a question on the displayed subject.

Game 4
The chips are down in THE game for quiz aficionados!  Successfully gain and defend subject chips to win.  The initiative is with the question master until, by your brilliance, you claim the MASTERQUIZ chip!

Name: Anker auf!
Description:
Players race a boat from a south city of the Dutch Ijsselmeer to the north. Players can decide whether to use the sails (faster but depending on the weather) or engine (slower). Changing wind directions and special events affect the players moves.
DSV usually publishes books for sailors (in German). The game was produced by Ravensburger promotion service. Funny: board shows an abstract drawing of the Ijsselmeer, and there is a note on the lower left telling: "Map is not suitable for navigation."

Name: Short Vowel Lotto
Description: Players learn to identify short vowels through rhyming and/or matching activities.

Name: Math Magic 2
Description:
Math Magic 2

The challenge continues - The same rules and strategies apply as in the original Math Magic™ but the challenge continues with Square Values, Cubes, Square Roots, Cube Roots and Joker Tiles.

Name: Trackin' Animals: Mammals in the Rain Forest, Grassland, and Arctic
Description: Grab your binoculars and join the Wild Goose team on a Trackin’ Animals photo safari! Three different games in each box have players chasing animals across the continents, through the oceans, and even back in time. Collect and assemble animal photos, draw and trade cards to make matching pairs, and correctly answer trivia questions to win these games, but watch out for all kinds of crazy twists when special Wild Cards appear! Each set contains 56 cards and directions for three different games to play. Ages 5 and up.

Name: Trackin' Animals: Wild & Extreme
Description: Grab your binoculars and join the Wild Goose team on a Trackin’ Animals photo safari! Three different games in each box have players chasing animals across the continents, through the oceans, and even back in time. Collect and assemble animal photos, draw and trade cards to make matching pairs, and correctly answer trivia questions to win these games, but watch out for all kinds of crazy twists when special Wild Cards appear! Each set contains 56 cards and directions for three different games to play. Ages 5 and up.

Name: Learning to Sequence
Description:
Game contains sets of three pictures in a sequence which must be properly arranged by the player.  Examples include a girl planting seeds, kids getting dressed, building a castle out of blocks, and so on.

All sequences are "self checking" - the backs form a solid image so kids can turn them over to see if they arranged them correctly.

48 durable 3.75in. x 4.5in. picture cards, Self-checking cards, Game directions in English and Spanish, Activity guide, Ages 3 and Up, 16 picture stories

Name: Elephants Never Forget: Memory Matching
Description:
Box includes three different memory and matching games and a parent/teacher activity guide for teaching with the game.  Pieces can be used to teach memory skills or matching sets of similar objects.

Ages 3 and up, 36 durable cards. Two-sided, colorful game mat. Game directions in English and Spanish. Activity guide (5.5in. x 8.5in.)

Name: Sumitup
Description:
Maths Scrabble - put tiles on the board to make simple maths equations (like 3+6=9, 2x5=10 etc), score points based on the tiles used.

Ages 4 and up

From the Box:
Sumitup - The board game that makes numbers fun!

Contents: 134 Tiles in a Cloth Bag; Playing Board; 4 Tile Holders; Rule Book

Name: Double Tangoes
Description:
Double Tangoes is the extension of Tangoes, using two sets of tans in each puzzle, instead of one.  The package consists of four sets of seven tans, in two colors, and about a hundred puzzle cards.

The two player game has two players racing to construct the same picture; but it's just as likely that you'll play solitaire,  or play cooperatively.

Doubling the pieces more than doubles the difficulty of regular Tangoes.

Name: Magna Force
Description: A balance game in which players must roll a die and remove a pillar from the tower that matches the dies' color. The pillars are removed by using a magnetic rod. Play continues until the tower collapses. The player who made it collapse gets no points, and the others add up the pillars they successfully removed, tallying up their scores.

Name: Kampen om Rai
Description:
This game is included in a series of books called "Drageherren" ("The Dragon master", an easy-to-read fantasy series by Josefine Ottesen). The basic game comes with the first book in the series and the rest of the books will have small expansions to the game.

The basic game plays a little like the old Titan boardgame, with each player having secret armies on the map. Each player got one treasure hidden in one of his armies, and the goal is to get both of them to Rai (the capital in the middle of the board) and keep them there for 3 turns.

The two players will try to get his armies into the most favorable terrain which is different for each unit. Each army got one leader and two units (hidden at the start of the game) and the combat is simple dice rolling. The board is made in the same way as in Settlers of Catan, and  uses hexes with various terrain.

"Kampen om Rai" was published as a "base" set in book 1. Followed by 10 sequels with 10 expansions total.
Some expansions inlcude more players, more cards and the "veteran unit" extra cards.

Book 8 opens for sea battles and sea monsters
Book 9 and 10 contributes with a boardgame map (poster-like)

Name: Pitwits
Description:
The quick-witted game for for quick-witted people!

Pitwits challenges you to think fast, but think straight.  You all take a turn to read a set of five clues to the others, the clues get easier as more are read.  You simply shout out the answer when you think you know it; if correct all the others move down the board towards the pit and out of the game, if wrong then you move towards the pit.

Movement is related to the number of clues which have been read before the answer is given - the more clues, the less movement - e.g. 1 clue = 5 spaces, 5 clues = 1 space.

The last player left in the game wins.

Name: Colour Magic
Description:
Colour Magic

From the makers of Math Magic™ and Math Magic 2™ comes a new challenge as a puzzle for a single player or a game for two players. Colour Magic relies on your power of deduction to place your tiles on the board so they do not cover any of a designated color. The player who places the most tiles wins. Sounds simple? This game will challenge all who love games of logic and strategy. Great for travel! Contains small parts, not suitable for children under the age of four.

Name: Buster Brown and the Goat
Description:
A card game featuring Buster Brown, Tige, and friends similar to Old Maid. The Goat is the odd card or the "Old Maid" that you don't want to be caught with or you lose the game!

Rules from the game box:
Deal 3 cards to each player and 3 to the table face up. If the Goat is dealt to the table, he must be put back in the pack shuffled, and a new card dealt to the table in its place.

The first player must make a pair by matching a card on the table with one in his hand if he can, at the same time reading aloud the title of the card, for instance, "I am Buster's Father". He then takes the trick to himself. If he cannot make a pair in that way, then he must play a card on the table, any one he likes, except for the Goat.

After his play, he must then take the top card from the pack, so that he will always hold 3 cards, until the pack runs out, when there are no more cards to draw from. Then, if a player cannot make a pair by matching one on the table, he may make one from his hand. If he can do neither, he must draw a card from his left-hand neighbor and try to make a pair from the table or from his hand, and so on, until the last card remains unplayed which must be the Goat. The player with that card must hold it up and say "I am the Goat."

Name: Friendzee: Christian Character Edition
Description:
Players move game pieces around the Friendzee game board by rolling cubes that direct them to draw from three sets of cards:
1) LIVE OUT LOUD--surprising and meaningful experiences challenge participants to tell stories, sculpt clay, write, sketch, perform charades...and more.
2) DIVE IN DEEP--gets them digging into Bible passages and studying God's Word together on a more personal level.
3) RISKZEE--a roll of the dice directs players to do both wacky and Bible-themed activities as they explore Scripture.
All three cards guide teens around the game board and to the ENDZEE. There are no winners and no losers--the game ends when everyone reaches the ENDZEE and commits to a challenge for the week.

The Christian Character Edition encourages teen to deepen their faith by discussing Courage, Integrity, Humility, Grace, Compassion, and Perseverance.

Name: XIG 4E: Air Pathway
Description:
XIG is a tile-laying game where players try to be the first to complete their own pathway - based on one of four elements: Earth, Water, Fire, and Air - as quickly as possible by laying down puzzle-piece style tiles. There are also cards that can help you advance or hinder your opponent. The pathways are sold in complete sets, and booster packs of cards are currently planned.

The base game includes the Water and Earth pathways.  This is one of the first two expansions for the game (the other being the Fire pathway).  It includes the entire Air pathway, a set of XAG cards, a small "collector's" box, and 2 special bonus "new edition" XAG cards plus 1 special "limited edition" foil puzzle piece.  Other future expansions are hinted at in the rules.

Expands:

    XIG: The Four Elements

Name: Barnum's Animals Crackers Game
Description:
An over-sized animal crackers box (complete with string handle) containing 16 animal cards, 9 plastic animal crackers/cookies and a cloth bag to put them in.

The rules describe three games to be played with these components, all of which are memory/matching games:

1) One card is placed face down for each animal in the bag.  Players draw an animal from the bag and then attempt to flip over the corresponding card.  Success allows the player to retain the card and animal cracker, while failure requires the player to return the cracker to the bag and flip the card back over.

2) As above, but two cards are placed for each animal and players must attempt to match the drawn cracker with both matching cards.

3) All cards are placed face-down in a stack.  Players draw a card from the stack and then attempt to retrieve the matching animal cracker from the bag by feel (without looking).  Success allows the player to keep the matching set, while failure requires that the animal be returned to the bag.

In all cases, the winner is the player with the most card/cracker sets.

Best played while nibbling on Barnum's Animals Crackers.

Name: The New and Fashionable Game of the Jew
Description:
Cloth-backed, hand-colored folding engraving with slip cover.  Shows a publication date of May 27th, 1807.  Board is 18.5 x 16", cover is 7 x 5".

Game is played with two six-sided dice, but while I have pictures of the case and board, I can find no explantion of game play other than this quote from "Deconstructing Sondheim", a March 8, 1993 New Yorker article by Stephen Schiff:

When you enter his five-story town house in midtown Manhattan, the first thing you notice, besides an enormous black poodle named Max, is his antique-game collection: on the walls, in glass museum cases, on various low tables. Most of the items look faintly sinister: here is something called Schimmel, or Ball and Hammer and here an inscrutable British concoction, Squails, and, behind the sofa, his earliest acquisition—the ghastly New and Fashionable Game of the Jew, a dice game devised in 1811 that, according to Sondheim, "taught kids to be anti-Semitic. But all the games you see here are very nice to look at and real boring," he adds. "This thing about games—I'm not really fascinated with games."

--
Looks to be a variation of Gluckshaus.  Roll both dice and pay the amount rolled onto the space of the same value.  If there is something already on the space, collect it instead.  Rolling a 7 always pays to the Jew space.  Rolling a 12 collects all the counters on the board.
From: http://www.gamesetal.net/Stock_Pages/GLB/glb3930.htm

Name: Watson's Education
Description:
This is based on my older game Watson's Bible Inquest (Biblical characters have been replaced with historical figures).  It is a game of deduction where players draw cards and must deduce which historical figures are in the opponents hands based on a set of questions.  Points are awarded for correct guesses and points given to the opponents for incorrect guesses.  The game is scalable for different age groups or experience.  It is also educational, although this aspect is not necessary (players may use the charts provided with the game instead).

It is available for free download (Print and Play) at my web site:

http://www.tzon.org/watson.htm

Name: Watson's Bible Inquest
Description:
This is my new game of deduction.  Players draw cards and must deduce which Biblical characters are in the opponents hands based on a set of questions.  Points are awarded for correct guesses and points given to the opponents for incorrect guesses.  The game is scalable for different age groups or experience.  It is also educational, although this aspect is not necessary (players may use the charts provided with the game instead).

It is available for free download (Print and Play) at my web site:

http://www.tzon.org/watson.htm

Name: Vulgarville
Description:
Filled with naughty cartoons and dirty jokes, this wild party game will leave you in hysterics!

In Vulgarville, "worst is first". Your goal is to become the town's Mayor. This means bribing, stealing and back stabbing as you race to accumulate votes. Meet the hilarious town patrons, such as Chuck Chunks and Skidmark Rose. These patrons will vote for you throughout the game... if you can hold on to them!

The title derives from a German phrase, meaning something ordinary. (Originally it came from a machine gun, used a lot in World War I, and was made popular because of a bestselling war novel and film of this title.) The game however is an abstract speed game. It consists of 108 cards in 9 colours, denoted "0", "8" or "15". Goal for each player is to collect the most card sets in one colour, consisting of one card of each number.

Decks of each number are separated. "0" and "15" are each shuffled, and put as two face up stack on the table. "8" cards are shared evenly among players, and put as face down stacks in front of them. Determined by numbers of players, a given number of "8" cards are revealed from each players deck, and everybody tries to match the two face up cards from the common decks with their tableau. If they find the "0" matching to one of their "8", they put it below their card. A matching "15" they put on top of their "8". Once a set is complete, it is removed into a victory point pile and another "8" from the players deck takes it place. Game ends, as soon the decks are depleted.

Name: Mauseschlau & Bärenstark: Wissen, Lachen, Sachen machen
Description:
From Adam Spielt:

A set-collection and action game. This fun-filled roll-and-move game with mouse and bear doesn't just demand knowledge, but also activity! Mouse asks all sorts of interesting questions, and Bear asks the players to carry out all sorts of actions. Lots of new things to learn and lots to laugh about! Guaranteed fun for young and old!

Contents: 1 game board, 6 playing figures, 80 cards, 1 die, 2 watch hands.

Name: Checkered Flag
Description:
Checkered Flag is similar in nature to Formula 1 and Speed Circuit.  Players choose their cars speed on a dashboard and move one space for every 20 miles per hour.  The same dashboard is used to track fuel usage, tire wear and brake wear.  Players also have a small hand of five cards that provide certain benefits when played.  Unlike the other two games, Checkered Flag simulates stock car racing.

Given that speeds are more constant in stock car racing, there are only three speed choices; 60, 120 and 180 miles per hour.  At the beginning of the race and after a pit stop, cars start off at 60.  In the two turns, the maximum speed is 120.  The turns drive the primary choices available, as some lanes provide a shorter path than others.  The choice lanes have a cost in fuel usage or tire wear.  The first car to complete three laps wins the race.

Name: Schleckermaul
Description:
Players each represent one of the 'little gourmands', a snail, frog, ladybug or mouse.  Players move by throwing a three sided die unique to that creature.  The object is to collect four food tokens of your color or black.  If you pick the color of another player, they have the chance of 'winning' the food if they can guess which hand you are hiding it in.

Ages 3-5.

Name: Gulpin' Guppies
Description:
From the publisher:

Something's fishy around here....it must be Gulpin' Guppies! Gobble up the competition as you swim toward the beach, but don't let them gobble you first! Goofy Gulpin' Guppies fit inside one another, making quick fish food out of unsuspecting swimmers! Make your way as you watch out for the wave or you may get all washed up! Be the first to get all 4 of your guppies to the beach, and you're the Guppy that gets the glory! Ages 4 and up.

Players are trying to get their four fish through a set of rapids. The first player to do this is the winner. Obstacles like hungry bigger fish and furious waves try to spot you from getting through the rapids.

Name: Gabula u Gabeli
Description:
A game based on a theory that the legendary city of Troy was located somewhere near Gabela (small town in Bosnia and Herzegovina). That's why it is called "Gabula u Gabeli" which can be translated as "Trouble in Gabela".
Players take roles of heroes from Greek mythology. The goal of the game is to discover Troy and win Helen's heart.

Name: Foto Yu
Description: A game in which you travel across the republics of former Yugoslavia and take photographs of beautiful landscapes and historical monuments. Player who takes the most photos is the winner.

Name: Sure Shot Baseball
Description:
Various versions of this game have existed for many years. I am not sure if this game has been renamed?

Sure Shot Baseball is a two person game played much the same way as outdoor baseball.  The game consists of nine innings of 3 outs each.  The "pitcher" rolls a plastic marble down a slide and it heads toward a batter controlled by their opponent.  The "batter" tries to hit the ball out of the stadium by turning a batting knob.  If it goes out of the unique up-curved field the "fielder" then tries to catch it.  Singles, doubles, triples, foul balls, and home runs are determined where the ball goes over the wall.  The "runners" stay in their team dugouts until it is time to position them on the field.

Each "batter" gets only one pitch. A missed pitch counts as one out.  Each team gets three outs and then players change positions.  Players play nine innings and whomever has the most runs wins.

There are a few other simple rules.  The game is quite tricky to learn and play competitively.  But it is definitely a fun experience if you enjoy baseball!!

Name: Camp
Description: Each player has seven pieces representing tents on a 6x5 board representing a field. Beside the board, a marker indicates how many spaces pieces can move (1, 2, or 3). The players take turn moves a tent vertically, horizontally, or diagonally into a free space (without jumping or capturing). After moving, the player moves the movement marker one space clockwise, which chenges the rate of movement for the opposing player. The player who moves his pieces such that none of his tents are adjacent to each other is the winner. A nice little game from Abacus (weisse Serie).

Name: I Can Do Anything! Game
Description:
The I Can Do Anything! Game is a fun way to learn about what people do for a living. Spin the wheel, move your piece, and tell a wonderful story all about different professions. Then make a wish about what you would like to be when you grow up! The enclosed booklet describes 24 different professions.

Objective: To be the first player to get to the Wish Star and make a wish.

Name: My First Matching Game
Description: This beautifully illustrated matching game takes an innovative approach to teaching children the richness of the African American experience.  Categories include:   history, science, inventors, athletes, entertainers and culture.  Game includes gameboard, 48 picture cards and a history booklet on each hero or cultural aspect featured.  For Ages 3 to 6

Name: Das Arche-Noah Spiel
Description: The Great Flood is coming and players are helping Noah to get the animals into the Ark.

Name: High 5
Description:
"High 5" is a party game that, like the more popular "Cranium" which it pre-dates, combines five party-style games into one.

Players (or teams) roll four 10-sided dice to generate a four-digit number that corresponds to a question in "The Book of 10,000 Questions." The number also indicates which of the five categories of game type the player will have. The categories are: "Pic-Wit" (Pictionary) "Bull-Wit" (Balderdash) "Ham-Wit" (Charades) "Sher-Wit" (20 Questions) and "Wiz-Wit" (Trivia).

The question book indicates how many spaces the players advance. In some situations, both the players asking the questions and the players responding will be able to advance. In other situations, an incorrect answer will send a player backwards along the track.

Questions for younger players are included in the question book, allowing players to create an easier game for children.

Name: Saint Seiya Cardgame Collection
Description:
It's a Collectible Card Game based on the popular anime series Saint Seiya,  all in Japanese.

It seems you battle your characters using Cosmo points in various power fields : speed, Temperature and Psychokinesis. The playing mat looks fairly similar to the knights of the zodiac one, but the game seems completely different (different stats, different card design)

Name: Trip Trap
Description:
Players attempt to negotiate a plastic obstacle course using ball bearings fired from whale shooters.  The five obstacles may be arranged in the specific order and layout as suggested in the instructions, or the course can be made harder by increasing the distance between obstacles.  Each obstacle has a unique gimmick and name, such as 'Big Dumper' and 'Man With Falling Pants'.

The first player to successfully negotiate all five obstacles is the winner.

Name: Brainsweat
Description:
From the back of the box:

Destined to become a classic.

"The bottom line of Brainsweat is to earn the most points." Points are based on correct answers but more so on fooling other players.

Brainsweat variations: Scramble. Find as many words as possible in the mixed up letters.

Example: Seafscier--Fricassee (unscrambled word)-sea-ice-far-rice, etc.

Reverse: Co-players attempt to guess the word which has been defined or to create a convincing phony.

Hilarious "Oh no what now" cards that add another dimension that can be friend or foe.

Example: I've never been to France, but I love French Fries. Add 5 points to my score.

Warning: The "Sturgeon" General has determined this game could be habit forming.

Includes gameboard, 500 Brainsweat cards, 2 dice, 40 "Oh no what now" cards, 1 minute timer, 6 playing pieces, 6 pencils, score pad, answer pad, history of the game, scoring rule summary, and instructions

Name: X-Ceter-O
Description: X für O? is a new twist on the classic Tic-Tac-Toe game. It includes six game pieces: three Os marked 1, 3 and 5 and three Xs marked 2, 4 and 6. You play on 3 x 3 game board grid. The pieces are played in numerical order. Once the six pieces are on the board, play continues in sequential fashion, with each move exposing the now-vacated square to the opponent. The action ends only when the first player achieves a three-in-a-row combination. With this game there is never a tie.

Name: Gnaqush
Description:
It’s not just the nickname of the game’s designer – it’s what you’ll do with your teeth as your carefully-laid plans get thwarted and blocked over and over again in this strategic Icehouse game for 4 players.

Original game design and concept by Nash, with additional modifications and variants by The Monday Night Games Group.

Object: Promote your one-pip pieces up to two-pip pieces, then three-pip pieces – eventually promoting the three-pip pieces to Nirvana. The first player with all pieces in Nirvana wins.

You Need

* One Icehouse stash for each player. Each player must have a different color.
    * A chessboard.
    * (optional) – 16 blocker tokens to fill spaces to modify the board for two or three players.

Normal Play: On your turn you can Jump over an adjacent piece or Slide (Move) one of your valid pieces Move to an adjacent square. When you move a piece or stack into a space occupied by another piece or a stack of pieces, you must cap that stack with the piece(s) you moved.

Ascension: If one or more of your pieces is in your goal square at the end of any turn and your home square is vacant, you must remove one of your pieces from your home square. Set it on its side in front of you, off the board. Put a piece that’s one pip larger point up in your home square. If the piece you removed was a three-pip piece, it has ascended to Nirvana – do not put a piece in your home square.

Winning: If you’re the first player to send your last three-pip piece to Nirvana, the game ends and you win.

Download the full rules plus variants to the rules here:
http://www.invisible-city.com/play/271/gnaqush

Name: Play the Beats
Description:
From the Rules:

"THIS IS A MUSIC FUN GAME."

The object of the game is to take your marker along the music staff starting with the introduction going all the way to FINE.

A game apparently designed to teach musical terminology and note counting.

Name: Bitter Victory
Description:
A game of the Allied invasion of Sicily, 1943.


(from the publisher:)

Most of the rules and mechanics will be familiar to anyone who has ever played a wargame. BSO, however, has added to this simplicity a combat system that rates units for how many dice they get to roll on their behalf, as well as what kind of dice (small arms or heavy weapons). No CRTs, no siree!

The game also uses cards, one deck (of 10) for each player (whose cards are somewhat different from those of the other player) to enhance the game. (They don’t 'drive' the game and they can be left out, if you’re so inclined.)  The cards are turned into a Resource system that gives the players a number of points which they can use to buy cards or rally units. The choice is theirs, but there are far more choices than points.

The cards, themselves, give the players 'Opportunities', from using their Tank capabilities, to getting more supplies, to special Reaction movement, to appearances by Patton and Monty.

Playing time for BITTER VICTORY has averaged 3 hours, sometimes less, and the rules are only 8 pages, including a section on Solitaire play!

Available in English or French

Components:

    1 rules and scenario booklet with historical introduction (8 pages)
    1 A1 map of Sicily 
    20 colored Opportunity Cards 
    224 counters (NATO Symbols) 
    1 Aid Cards


The Sicily map and the Opportunity Cards have been designed by Pascal Da Silva.

Name: Anastasia
Description:
Also referred to as Rasputin's Revenge. This game was premium giveaway item to customers of Shell service stations to promote Twentieth Century Fox Film's theatrical release of their animated film, Anastasia. The game comes with the board folded into a triangular suitcase that holds plastic playing pieces of the movie's five main characters and a sheet that folds into a 6-sided die.

The object of the game is for players to safely arrive in Paris and defeat the evil Rasputin. They accomplish this by rolling the die to move ahead the indicated number of spaces. Players must then follow the directions on the space, if provided. To win, players must reach the last space and then be the first to make the correct die roll to destroy Rasputin.
